columns.column_business_interpretation: This is the primary key for the customer table and serves as a reference to link customer data with orders in the `olist_orders_dataset`, allowing analysts to analyze customer order habits, retention, and lifetime value.

columns.column_comment: Unique identifier for each customer across orders
columns.column_business_interpretation: Used to identify repeat customers across multiple orders, enabling analysis of customer loyalty and purchasing patterns.

columns.column_comment: Zip code prefix of the customer's location
columns.column_business_interpretation: Links to `olist_geolocation_dataset` to provide geographic analysis of customer distribution, enabling segmentation and regional performance analysis.
Useful for geo-segmentation analysis, allowing aggregation of sales data by city to identify regional trends and hotspots.
Enables aggregation by state for regional analysis, supporting targeted marketing strategies and state-wise performance reporting.

tables.foreign_key_comment: Links customer location data to geolocation data using zip code prefix.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Provides demographic data necessary to analyze customer distribution and behavior by geographic area and link with orders.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Serves as a unique identifier to link customer information with orders.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: Enables geographic insights by linking zip code information with geolocation data.

columns.column_business_interpretation: This key links order items to orders, enabling analysis of each item sold per order, thus providing insights into product sales performance per order.

columns.column_comment: Sequence number of the item in the order
columns.column_business_interpretation: Indicates item count per order, useful for analyzing order complexity, and average number of items per order.
Connects products to order items, facilitating analysis of product popularity, cross-selling opportunities, and stock management by joining with `olist_products_dataset`.
Links sellers to their orders, allows performance measurement of sellers, and comparison of revenue by joining with `olist_sellers_dataset`.

columns.column_comment: Deadline for the item to be shipped
columns.column_business_interpretation: Enables the analysis of shipping performance and time-to-ship metrics which are critical for understanding logistics efficiency.
Facilitates revenue calculation on a per-item basis and helps in pricing strategy analysis when aggregated across orders.

columns.column_comment: Cost of shipment for the item
columns.column_business_interpretation: Allows evaluation of shipping cost efficiency and its impact on order profitability when combined with `price`.

tables.table_name_comment: Details of items in each order.
tables.primary_key_comment: Composite key (order_id, order_item_id) due to multiple items per order.
tables.foreign_key_comment: Links each order item to its respective order, product, and seller.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Allows detailed analysis of sales by item, essential for understanding product and seller performance.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Enables identification of line items within orders.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: Facilitates multi-dimensional sales performance analysis through linked tables.

columns.column_business_interpretation: Essential for linking orders to their details in the `olist_order_items_dataset`, enabling complete order and sales analysis.

columns.column_comment: References the customer who placed the order
columns.column_business_interpretation: Connects orders to customers to evaluate customer behavior and lifetime value when joined with `olist_customers_dataset`.
Facilitates the analysis of order fulfillment stages, conversion rates, and identification of delivery issues.

columns.column_comment: Timestamp when the order was placed
columns.column_business_interpretation: Enables analysis of sales trends over time and peak shopping periods.

columns.column_comment: Timestamp when the order was approved
columns.column_business_interpretation: Helps analyze the order approval workflow and identify delays in processing orders.

columns.column_comment: Date the order was delivered to the carrier
columns.column_business_interpretation: Allows analysis of logistics and carrier delivery performance.

columns.column_comment: Date the order was delivered to customer
columns.column_business_interpretation: Crucial for evaluating delivery performance and customer wait times.

columns.column_comment: Estimated delivery date of the order
columns.column_business_interpretation: Used to assess delivery accuracy and improve reliability predictions.

tables.foreign_key_comment: Links orders to customer demographic data.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Central table for analyzing order and sales metrics, connects directly to customers and their purchasing behavior.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Facilitates detailed tracking and analysis of specific orders.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: Connects customer data for enhanced demographic analysis.

columns.column_business_interpretation: Connects payment information with order details, essential for financial analysis and revenue tracking by order.

columns.column_comment: Sequential number of the payment (for multiple payments in orders)
columns.column_business_interpretation: Useful for understanding payment patterns and installment plans, supporting sales strategy.
Facilitates the analysis of payment method popularity and customer preferences across different sales channels.
Critical for cash flow analysis and financial forecasting, supports installment payment tracking.

columns.column_comment: Total paid amount for the order or installment
columns.column_business_interpretation: Allows revenue calculations by order, crucial for financial reporting, and pricing evaluations.

tables.table_name_comment: Information on payments related to orders.
tables.primary_key_comment: No single primary key due to multiple payments per order.
tables.foreign_key_comment: Links payment information to order records.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Provides detailed insights into payment behaviors, enabling improved payment strategy and financial analysis.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Facilitates tracking of payments without standalone primary key.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: Ties payment data directly to order records for financial insights.

columns.column_business_interpretation: Key for linking product details with sales in `olist_order_items_dataset`, vital for product performance analysis.
Enables category-level sales analysis and consumer preference segmentation.
May correlate with product clarity and customer purchase confidence analysis.
Can be used to assess the effect of description detail on sales conversion.

columns.column_comment: Number of photos for the product
columns.column_business_interpretation: Important for understanding the relationship between visual content and sales success.

columns.column_comment: Weight of the product in grams
columns.column_business_interpretation: Useful for logistics planning and shipping cost analysis.
Facilitates packaging and delivery planning, and cost assessments.
Integral to product dimension analysis, enables optimal storage and shipment.
Part of dimensional analysis aiding in packaging efficiency.

tables.table_name_comment: Details about each product available for sale.
tables.primary_key_comment: Unique product identifier for joining with sales data.
tables.foreign_key_comment: No foreign keys as this is a standalone product catalog table.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Essential for catalog management and product-feature analysis, connects with sales data to assess product performance.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Provides unique linkage key to associated sales data.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: No foreign key relationships, used as reference table.

columns.column_business_interpretation: Allows tracking of reviews related to specific orders, provides a link to qualitative analysis of customer feedback.

columns.column_comment: Identifier linking to the order being reviewed
columns.column_business_interpretation: Connects reviews to orders to evaluate customer satisfaction and gather feedback on specific order experiences.

columns.column_comment: Rating score given by the customer
columns.column_business_interpretation: Used to measure customer satisfaction and product performance, beneficial for reputation management and quality control.
Provides qualitative insights into customer expectations and initial product impressions.
Delivers detailed customer feedback, useful for sentiment analysis and service improvement strategies.

columns.column_comment: Date when the review was created
columns.column_business_interpretation: Helps in analyzing the timeliness of reviews and post-purchase engagement.

columns.column_comment: Timestamp when the review was responded to
columns.column_business_interpretation: Allows analysis of response times and customer support efficiency.

tables.table_name_comment: Contains reviews written by customers for orders.
tables.foreign_key_comment: Links reviews to order dataset to allow cross-referencing with sales data.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Facilitates evaluation of customer feedback on orders, enabling comprehensive sentiment and satisfaction analysis.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Provides unique reference for tracking individual reviews.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: Enables connection to orders for multi-dimensional feedback analysis.

columns.column_comment: Zip code prefix for geographical area
columns.column_business_interpretation: Primary connection point for geographic data, enabling location-based analysis of both customers and sellers.
Facilitates geospatial analysis, critical for mapping customer and seller locations.
Complements latitude for complete geospatial analysis, supports geographic trends analysis.
Aids in city-level segmentation and trend analysis when joined with orders and customer tables.
Key for state-level aggregation and regional performance analysis, supports strategic decision making.

tables.table_name_comment: Provides geographical coordinates associated with Brazilian zip code prefixes.
tables.primary_key_comment: Unique identifier for geographical data by zip code prefix.
tables.foreign_key_comment: No foreign keys, but serves as a reference for geographic data.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Supports location-based insights and demographic analysis when combined with customer and seller data.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: References location data for geographic insights.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: No direct foreign key relationships, but provides geospatial context for customer and seller data.

columns.column_business_interpretation: Key for linking seller details with their products and sales, enabling vendor analysis and sales performance evaluation.

columns.column_comment: Zip code prefix of the seller's location
columns.column_business_interpretation: Connects to geolocation data for geographical analysis and seller segmentation by location.

columns.column_comment: City where the seller is located
columns.column_business_interpretation: Useful for analyzing sales distribution and performance by city, assisting in market penetration strategies.

columns.column_comment: State where the seller is located
columns.column_business_interpretation: Supports state-level strategy planning and performance comparisons.

tables.table_name_comment: Details of sellers participating in the marketplace.
tables.primary_key_comment: Unique identifier for linking to sales data.
tables.foreign_key_comment: Links seller location data to geographic dataset using zip code prefix.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Facilitates understanding of seller performance and geographic distribution.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Serves as the identifier for connecting sellers to their products and sales.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: Links seller locations to geolocation data for spatial analysis.

columns.column_business_interpretation: Provides native language product categorization, useful for localized product analysis.

columns.column_comment: English translation of the product category name
columns.column_business_interpretation: Facilitates analysis across international teams and aids in global strategy development by providing category translations.

tables.table_name_comment: Maps product category names from original to English.
tables.primary_key_comment: Unique category identifier for translation reference.
tables.foreign_key_comment: No foreign keys as this is a standalone translation table.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Enables product category understanding across language barriers, essential for global market analysis.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Used to consistently reference product categories across datasets.
tables.foreign_key_business_interpretations: No direct foreign key relationships, used for understanding category translations.
